result.execSummary:
The defendant Cayetano Villanueva Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Sexual Exploitation-Employ,Use,Induce, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.05(1)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay mandatory costs, assessments, $3,000.00 pornography surcharge and surcharges. To be paid by end of sentence or civil judgment to be entered against defendant and subject to other collection.
______
Court finds that there were six images in count one that qualify for the pornography surcharge.

Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and pay mandatory surcharge, cannot vote until his civil rights are restored; must comply with the sex offender reporting requirements and cannot work or volunteer with children under the age of 16 years.
Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Villanueva shall have fourteen days from the date the supplemental return is filed with the clerk of this court to file his brief-in-chief in this appeal.

Defendant Cayetano Villanueva in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Cayetano Villanueva in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel, Yolanda V. and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample, pay the mandatory DNA surcharge, cannot vote until his civil rights are restored, must comply with the sex offender reporting requirements and cannot work or volunteer with children under the age of 16 years. 

Court finds there were six images in Count 1 that qualify for the pornography surcharge.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 22 years with 48 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 12 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 10 years; pay mandatory costs, assessments, $3,000 pornography surcharge  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 2 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 1 year; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 1 year - concurrent with Count 1; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
Letters received and filed for sentencing hearing./ds

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 646
cf

Case recalled.  Same appearances.

Court addresses a jury question.    At the hour of 1:57 p.m., the jury returned and by their foreperson returned a verdict as follows:

We the Jury, find the defendant, Cayetano Villanueva, Jr., guilty of Sexual Exploitation of a Child.  Dated at Milwaukee, Wisconsin, this 17 day of February, 2015.  If you find the defendant guilty, you must answer the following question:  Had the defendant attained the age of 18 years at the time of the offense?  X Yes.  Dated at Milwaukee, Wisconsin, this 17 day of February, 2015."

Court polls the jury.  State moves for judgment of conviction on the verdict.  Defense moves for judgment notwithstanding the verdict.  Court grants State's motion and orders a judgment of conviction be entered on the record.

Court orders defendant REMANDED into the custody of the sheriff.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by the victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and the defendant.   Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 48 hours in advance of the sentencing.  Case set for sentencing on 3-11-15 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 44.

Defendant Cayetano Villanueva in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Jury in the box at 9:02 a.m.  Testimony of Detective McQuown continues; Exhibit #9, 10 marked, identified, offered and received into evidence.   State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of the box at 9:30 a.m.  Defense moves to dismiss.  Arguments by counsel.  Court denies motion.  Court advises the defendant on his right to testify.  Court finds the defendant is freeling and knowingly waiving his right to not testify.  Jury in the box at 9:35 a.m.  Sworn-in for the defense:  Cayetano Villanueva, Jr.; Exhibit #11 marked, identified.  Jury out of the box at 10:37 a.m.   Exhbit #11 offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Defense moves for a directed verdict.  Court denies motion.  Jury in the box at 11:04 a.m.   Court instructions the jury.  Closing arguments by counsel.  Court charges the jury.  Court releases the jury for lunch and to return to the jury room at 1:15 p.m. to begin their deliberations  At the hour of 11:53, the jury retired to deliberate under the charge of Deputy Sheriffs John Schroeder and Robert Pekar who were duly sworn for that purpose.
JUSTICE POINT PRETRIAL REPORT, FILED

Jury in the box at 1:37 p.m.  Count continues with preliminary instructions.  Opening statements by counsel.  Jury out of the box at 1:54 p.m.  Jury in the box at 2:00 p.m.  Sworn-in for the State:  Steve M.; Exhibit #6 marked, identified; Michael M.; Exhibit #7, 8 marked, identified.  Jury out of the box at 3:26 p.m.  Jury in the box at 3:48 p.m.  Sworn-in for the State:  City of Vacaville, CA, Detective Jeff Datzman; Exhibits #1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 marked identified; Exhibits #1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 offered and received into evidence; Milwaukee Police Department Detective Richard McQuown.  Court adjourns case to 2-17-15 at 8:30 a.m.  Jury out of the box at 4:57 p.m.

Defendant Cayetano Villanueva in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Cayetano Villanueva in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties are prepared to proceed to jury trial.  Parties impanel a jury of 12 good and lawful citizens of Milwaukee County.  Voire Dire: 10:47 a.m.  Jury out of the box at 11:07 a.m.  Jury in the bpx at 11:14 a.m.  Voir Dire continues.  Jury out of the box at 11:23 a.m.  Jury in the box at 11:27 a.m.    Voire Dire continues.  Jury out of the box at 11:42 a.m.  Jury list received, filed and sealed.  Jury in the box at 11:46 a.m.  Jury sworn-in.  Court gives the jury preliminary instructions.  Court releases the jury for lunch.  Jury out of the box at 12:05 p.m.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Case will be set for sentencing after the jury trial on Count 1.

Defendant Cayetano Villanueva in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Cayetano Villanueva in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Final pretrial held in chambers on Count 1.  Court rules on motions in limine.  On motion of the defense, Court orders witnesses sequestered.  Defendant rejects any offers by the State.  Case remains set for jury trial.

Defendant Cayetano Villanueva in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State moves for an adjournment.   Defendant now states he would like another attorney.  Court advises the defendant he is allowed two appointments by the Public Defender's Office.  If motion is granted, this will be his second and final appointment.  Defendant states he understands.  Court grants motion and allows Attorney Steinberg to withdraw as counsel of record subject to public defender's office appointing new counsel.  Court cancels the jury trial.   

Court allows the defendant to go to see his new attorney provided he brings in proof.  Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 12. Case set for arraignment. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defendant Cayetano Villanueva in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Defendant Cayetano Villanueva in custody.  Janet Protasiewicz for Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
NO ADA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Arraignment scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. Absolutely no release from home, 24 hours curfew.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Juvenile M.M. and No use or possession of any electronic communication devices including, but not limited to internet use, computers, tablets, cell phones but permitting the defendant landline telephone use for emergencies. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cayetano Villanueva in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Defendant Cayetano Villanueva in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
